page.title: 07TRADE
page.content: Sunderland posseses a retailing centre of sufficient size and diversity to provide for the basic needs of the town's 300,000 population.It also serves a limited hinterland of 5/10 miles from the city centre. Most high street chainstores are present, but specialist shops providing high order and luxury goods are conspicuous by their absence. This reflects the high unemployment and relative poverty of the town, and also the proximity of Newcastle.Recently the town centre has experienced the arrival of certain new shops, and shows every sign of being a thriving retail centre. Away from the centre low order goods are available from small shops to serve the local population.
